basics.name: Orlando Gonzalez
basics.label: Information Assurance Analyst
basics.summary: Experienced Information System Security Officer with a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and services industry. Skilled in the RMF Process, Information Assurance, and Information Security. Strong information technology professional with a Bachelor's degree focused in Information Systems Security.  Currently hold a Top Secret Clearance.

work.name: Resource Management Concepts, Inc.
work.summary:
Perform duties as a Navy Qualified Validator.
Work in a team environment using the tools, processes and workflows of the Risk Management Framework and conduct Assessments and obtain Authorizations (RMF A&A)
Perform SCAP & ACAS scans and analyze results for needed remediation and reporting.
Use eMASS to record results while implementing RMF steps 1-6
Utilize eMASSTER and RAFT for the RMF process.
Perform quarterly delta and full annual STIG reviews in collaboration with system administrators.
Support IA requirements in a Windows 10 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux environment.
Perform centralized antivirus, system patching, configuration management, vulnerability scanning, and mitigation to meet security compliance requirements. 
Provide regular reporting on system(s) health.

work.name: Leidos
work.summary:
Scanned network and computers using ACAS.
Ran STIGS on computers and other networking devices.
Patched computers that were non compliant.
work.location: Camp Pendleton South, California, United States

work.name: VSolvit
work.summary:
• Perform duties as the command Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO).
• Create POAMs in support of the RMF Process.
• Conduct risk and vulnerability assessment at the network, system and application level using ACAS.
• Perform Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) checks on all devices and generate checklists using SCAP Compliance Checker and STIG Viewer.
• Remediation of computers.
• Prepared necessary documentation for upload to MCCAST in support of the RMF ATO package process.
work.location: Camp Pendleton North, California, United States

work.name: Deloitte
work.summary:
•	Conduct risk and vulnerability assessment at the network, system and application level using ACAS. 
•	Work with DOD cyber tools including ACAS, SCAP compliance checker and STIG viewer. 
•	Entered and updated information into eMASS as part of the RMF process.

work.name: Sentek Global
work.summary:
•	Conduct risk and vulnerability assessment at the network, system and application level using ACAS. 
•	Work with DOD cyber tools including ACAS, SCAP compliance checker and STIG viewer. 
•	Entered and updated information into eMASS as part of the RMF process.

work.name: Vectrus
work.summary:
•	Conducts risk and vulnerability assessment at the network, system and application level using ACAS. 
•	Work with DOD cyber tools involving ACAS, Security Center and Nessus.
•	Successfully attained an ATO for our network (NIPR / SIPR) through the RMF processes. 
•	Investigate and report on “IA incidents” such as spillage and network violations.
•	Generate detailed vulnerability reports used by Senior Management to evaluate the overall Cyber Security status and Systems Administration to apply patches and solutions.
•	Update and create POA&M in eMASS.
•	Perform monthly Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) checks on all devices and generate checklists using ACAS, SCAP Compliance Checker and STIG Viewer.
•	Process User Account Requests (SAAR-Ns).
•	Create Remedy tickets based on scan results.
•	Track, verify, and update users IA training compliance through the Army Training and Certification Tracking System (ATCTS).

work.name: CSRA Inc
work.summary:
•	Conducts risk and vulnerability assessment at the network, system and application level using ACAS. 
•	Work with DOD cyber tools involving ACAS, Security Center and Nessus.
•	Update IAVM status within VRAM.
•	Generate detailed vulnerability reports used by Senior Management to evaluate the overall Cyber Security status and Systems Administration to apply patches and solutions.
•	Conducts information security risk assessments and effectively communicates risk to program manager and client.
•	Interacts with various departments and individuals across the enterprise to achieve information security objectives.
•	Perform monthly Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) checks on all devices and generate checklists using ACAS, SCAP Compliance Checker and STIG Viewer.
•	Update RMF Framework as needed.
•	Process User Account Requests (SAAR-Ns).
•	Create Remedy tickets based on scan results.

work.name: Apex Systems
work.summary:
•	Assist systems engineers in meeting DISA established security profiles as well as customer determined Information Assurance objectives. Edit engineering documentation prior to submission for review by the customers IA review board. Assist the Domain Architect in presenting engineering designs and plans to the customers IA review board.
•	Create original DIACAP submissions for new systems and incorporate updates to pre-existing systems. Collect and review related information security artifacts (certifications, test results, configuration documentation) for C&A review.
•	Coordinate the timely testing and reporting of test results for various hardware and software solutions and systems. Perform actual tests and reviews as required to include ACAS and Retina vulnerability scans, SCAP Benchmark tests and manual STIG reviews.
•	Remediate or mitigate all outstanding vulnerabilities in accordance with DISA guidance to include changing device security profiles and settings, updating GPO’s and patching systems. Report and reconcile False Positives from testing and request exception acceptance from the DAA.
•	Function as the liaison in person, in writing and over the phone to Vendor representatives and to customer IA Validators as well as Certification Authorities addressing the IA posture of various packages and systems.

work.name: DataPath, Inc.
work.summary:
Maintain security posture of systems onboard MCTSSA (Marine Corp Tactical Systems Support Activity) Camp Pendleton.
Assist with C & A efforts of systems
Coordinate with Engineers, ISSM's, IAM, and vendors regarding their respective systems.
Implement DOD STIGs on systems using STIG Viewer.
Scan systems using ACAS and apply missing IAVA.
Provide information assurance vulnerability compliance, mitigation, and documentation IAW Information Assurance Vulnerability Management (IAVM) process.
DoD Cyber Tools - ACAS/Security Center/Nessus.
Performed Anti-Virus Scans and updates

work.name: General Dynamics Information Technology
work.summary:
Support SPAWAR System Center Pacific. Responsible for testing, support and security of US Navy Meteorological & Oceanographic (METOC) C4I systems.
Maintain virus / security requirements by the US Navy
Apply missing IAVA patches to network clients and servers using approved IA tools
Provide information assurance vulnerability compliance, mitigation, and documentation IAW Information Assurance Vulnerability Management (IAVM) process.

Perform SCAP & ACAS scans and analyze results for needed remediation and reporting.

Perform quarterly delta and full annual STIG reviews in collaboration with system administrators.
Support IA requirements in a Windows 10 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux environment.

Provide regular reporting on system(s) health.
